parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Plural
Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: From pros and erchomai; to approach, i.e. come near, visit, or worship, assent to.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
High priest, chief priest. From arche and hiereus; the high-priest; by extension a chief priest.
Comparative of presbus; older; as noun, a senior; specially, an Israelite Sanhedrist or Christian 'presbyter'.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: To curse, invoke curses, devote to destruction. From anathema; to declare or vow under penalty of execration.

parse: Reflexive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Plural

str2: A votive offering, a thing devoted to God; a curse, the thing cursed. From anatithemai; a ban or excommunicated.
(a) I taste, (b) I experience. A primary verb; to taste; by implication, to eat; figuratively, to experience.
A conjunction, preposition and adverb of continuance, until.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: To put to death, kill; fig: I abolish. From apo and kteino; to kill outright; figuratively, to destroy.
Paul, Paulus. Of Latin origin; Paulus, the name of a Roman and of an apostle.
